summary: Randomly select variant records according to specified options

arguments.name: --frequencySelectionMode
arguments.fulltext: This argument selects allele frequency selection mode. See the wiki for more information.

arguments.summary: If true, will ignore genotypes in VCF, will take AC,AF from annotations and will make no sample selection
arguments.name: --ignoreGenotypes
arguments.fulltext: Argument for the frequency selection mode. (AC/AF/AN) are taken from VCF info field, not recalculated. Typically specified for sites-only VCFs that still have AC/AF/AN information.

arguments.summary: If true, will ignore polymorphic status in VCF, and will take VCF record directly without pre-selection
arguments.name: --ignorePolymorphicStatus
arguments.fulltext: Argument for the frequency selection mode. Allows reference (non-polymorphic) sites to be included in the validation set.

arguments.summary: If true, will include filtered sites in set to choose variants from
arguments.name: --includeFilteredSites
arguments.fulltext: Do not exclude filtered sites (e.g. not PASS or .) from consideration for validation

arguments.name: --numValidationSites
arguments.fulltext: The number of sites in your validation set

arguments.summary: File to which variants should be written
arguments.name: --out

arguments.summary: Regular expression to select many samples from the ROD tracks provided. Can be specified multiple times
arguments.name: --sample_expressions
arguments.fulltext: Sample regexps to subset the input VCF to, prior to selecting variants. -sn NA12* subsets to all samples with prefix NA12

arguments.summary: File containing a list of samples (one per line) to include. Can be specified multiple times
arguments.name: --sample_file
arguments.fulltext: File containing a list of sample names to subset the input vcf to. Equivalent to specifying the contents of the file separately with -sn

arguments.summary: Include genotypes from this sample. Can be specified multiple times
arguments.name: --sample_name
arguments.fulltext: Sample name(s) to subset the input VCF to, prior to selecting variants. -sn A -sn B subsets to samples A and B.

arguments.name: --sampleMode
arguments.fulltext: A mode for selecting sites based on sample-level data. See the wiki documentation for more information.

arguments.summary: GL-based selection mode only: the probability that a site is non-reference in the samples for which to include the site
arguments.name: --samplePNonref
arguments.fulltext: An P[nonref] threshold for SAMPLE_SELECTION_MODE=POLY_BASED_ON_GL. See the wiki documentation for more information.

arguments.summary: Select only a certain type of variants from the input file. Valid types are INDEL, SNP, MIXED, MNP, SYMBOLIC, NO_VARIATION. Can be specified multiple times
arguments.name: --selectTypeToInclude
arguments.fulltext: This argument selects particular kinds of variants (i.e. SNP, INDEL) out of a list. If left unspecified, all types are considered.

arguments.summary: Input VCF file, can be specified multiple times
arguments.name: --variant

description:
This tool is intended for use in experiments where we sample data randomly from a set of variants, for example in order to choose sites for a follow-up validation study.

Sites are selected randomly but within certain restrictions. There are two main sources of restrictions:

  • Sample restrictions: A user can specify a set of samples, and we will only consider sites which are polymorphic within the given sample subset. These sample restrictions can be given as a set of individual samples, a text file (each line containing a sample name), or a regular expression. A user can additionally specify whether samples will be considered based on their genotypes (a non-reference genotype means that the sample is polymorphic in that variant, and hence that variant will be considered for inclusion in set), or based on their PLs.
  • Sampling methods:
    1. Uniform sampling will just sample uniformly from variants that are polymorphic in selected samples
    2. Sampling based on Allele Frequency spectrum will ensure that output sites have the same AF distribution as the input set
  • Variant type (SNP, Indel, etc.)

Input

One or more variant sets to choose from.

Output

A sites-only VCF with the desired number of randomly selected sites.

Usage examples

 java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \
   -T ValidationSiteSelectorWalker \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -V input1.vcf \
   -V input2.vcf \
   -sn NA12878 \
   -o output.vcf \
   --numValidationSites 200   \
   -sampleMode POLY_BASED_ON_GT \
   -freqMode KEEP_AF_SPECTRUM
 
 java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \
   -T ValidationSiteSelectorWalker \
   -R reference.fasta \
   -V:foo input1.vcf \
   -V:bar input2.vcf \
   --numValidationSites 200 \
   -sf samples.txt \
   -o output.vcf \
   -sampleMode  POLY_BASED_ON_GT \
   -freqMode UNIFORM \
   -selectType INDEL
name: ValidationSiteSelector
